title.narrative: Madagascar - Emergency Food Security and Reconstruction Project

description.narrative: The Project Development Objectives are to: (i) increase access to short-term employment in targeted food-insecure areas; and (ii) restore access to social and economic services following natural disasters in targeted communities.

comment.narrative: Components 1 and 4 of the Project were authorized to resume in November 2009.

This indicator is above end-of-project targets because in part FID initially authorized the rotation of workers during theimplementation of the cash-for-work program (see below the indicator related to the number of beneficiaries of the cash-for-workprogram).
This activity (Component 1) was authorized in November 2009.
This indicator is above end-of-project target partially because FID initially authorized the rotation of workers duringmicro-project execution.

title.narrative: I.2. Initiated social and economic services restored within 6 months following a natural disaster

comment.narrative: This activity (Component 3) was authorized in May 2010.

This ratio corresponds to the micro-projects that have been implemented to respond to the 2011/12 cyclone season. Theprioritization of the micro-project by the commune is taken as the beginning of the 6 months. More specifically, FID has been ableto rehabilitate within six-month 56% of the sub-projects that it was responsible to implement in the aftermath of the 2011/12cyclone season.
This activity (related to Components 1, 2 and 3) was authorized in November 2009.
The end-of-project target has not been defined as the choice of micro-project type is not known a priori but depends oncommunity'sselection during Project implementation.

title.narrative: People in Project areas benefiting from improved roads

comment.narrative: This activity (related to Components 1, 2 and 3) was authorized in November 2009.
The end-of-project target has not been defined as the choice of micro-project type is not known a priori but depends oncommunity'sselection during Project implementation.

title.narrative: Number of people in rural areas provided with access to Improved Water Sources under the project

comment.narrative: This activity (related to Components 2 and 3) was authorized in May 2010.
The end-of-project target has not been defined as the choice of micro-project type is not known a priori but depends oncommunity'sselection during Project implementation.

title.narrative: Improved community water points constructed or rehabilitated under the project

comment.narrative: This activity (related to Components 2 and 3) was authorized in May 2010.
The end-of-project target was not defined during Project preparation as the choice of micro-project type is not known a priori butdepends on community's selection during Project implementation.
This activity relates to Project management (Component 4) which was authorized to disburse in November 2009.
This indicator relates to all micro-Projects implemented under this Project.

title.narrative: Number of additional classrooms built or rehabilitated at the primary level resulting from project interventions.

comment.narrative: This indicator relates to all micro-Projects implemented under this Project.
This indicator relates to community-based infrastructure component (Component 2) which was authorized in May 2010.

title.narrative: Health facilities constructed, renovated, and/or equipped (number)

comment.narrative: This indicator relates to component 2 and 3.
The number of health facilities is below target because communes have generally prioritized the reconstruction of schools.
This indicator relates to post-catastrophe reconstruction (Component 3) which was authorized in May 2010.
This indicator relates to post-catastrophe reconstruction (Component 3) which was authorized in May 2010.
This indicator relates to post-catastrophe reconstruction (Component 3) which was authorized in May 2010.
This indicator relates to post-catastrophe reconstruction (Component 3) which was authorized in May 2010.
Communes have prioritized the rehabilitation of schools (instead of that of roads) during project implementation.

title.narrative: IRI 3.4 Health centers built or rehabilitated

comment.narrative: This indicator relates to post-catastrophe reconstruction which was authorized in May 2010.
Communes have comparatively preferred to prioritize schools (instead of health centers) during project implementation.
This indicator relates to the cash-for-work program (Component 1) which was authorized in November 2009.
This indicator relates to the cash-for-work program (Component 1) which was authorized in November 2009.

title.narrative: IRI 1.5 People in Project areas benefitting from improved roads implemented under the cash-for-work program

comment.narrative: This indicator relates to the cash-for-work program (Component 1) which was authorized in November 2009.
The end-of-project target was not defined during Project preparation as the choice of micro-project type is not known a priori butdepends on community's selection during Project implementation.

title.narrative: IRI 1.4 Percentage of women among beneficiaries

comment.narrative: This indicator relates to the cash-for-work program (Component 1) which was authorized in November 2009.
This indicator relates to the community-based infrastructure component (Component 2) which was authorized in May 2010.
This indicator is above target as numerous communities have selected "feeder roads" which have comparatively more beneficiariesthan other sub-project types.
This indicator relates to the community-based infrastructure component (Component 2) which was authorized in May 2010.
This indicator relates to the community-based infrastructure component (Component 2) which was authorized in May 2010.
This indicator is below target as few communities have selected the rehabilitation or irrigated land as a sub-project type.
This indicator relates to the roads rehabilitated under the cash-for-work program which was authorized in November 2009.

title.narrative: IRI 4.2 Sub-projects completed within contracted period

comment.narrative: This indicators relate to the micro-projects implemented under components 2 and 3.

title.narrative: IRI 4.5 Completion of an impact evaluation

comment.narrative: This is the second phase of the impact evaluation of the Community development Fund Project. This impact evaluation -- conductedbyINSTAT -- could not be finalized before due to the

title.narrative: IRI 4.4 Completion of a technical audit

comment.narrative: A technical audit has been finalized in December 2011.
